About Us | Hummingbird Music School Home About Us Awards Offerings Private Lessons After School Music Classes Summer Camp Calendar Careers News Contact Us Franchise With Us Giving flight to the next generation of musicians. ® Home About Us Awards Offerings Private Lessons After School Music Classes Summer Camp Calendar Careers News Contact Us Franchise With Us Hummingbird music school About Us At Hummingbird Music School, our staff helps the next generation of musicians take flight every day. We emphasize the fun of learning music in a relaxed, pressure-free environment designed to spark the joy of discovery in every child we teach, with a roster of highly qualified, experienced musicians and educators supporting their development. Meet Our Staff Francesca Draughon, Ph.D. Hummingbird Music School Founder Francesca is a classically trained musician and musicologist. She received a B.A. in Music from Indiana University, and she earned an M.A. and Ph.D. in Musicology from UCLA. From 1999 to 2000, she was named a Fulbright Scholar in Vienna, Austria. Her career started at Stanford University, where she taught interdisciplinary humanities courses, music history courses, and continuing studies classes as a post-doctoral Fellow in the Humanities. She began teaching private music lessons in 2009 and founded Hummingbird Music School in 2015. Francesca was appointed Arts Commissioner of Redwood City in 2022. Todd S. Piano, Guitar, Electric Bass, Ukulele, Group Piano, Group Ukulele, Rock Band Summer Camp Todd studied music performance at Foothill College and jazz composition at Berklee College of Music. For the past 20 years, he has been playing guitar in local indie rock bands, writing and recording original music, and performing in a jazz trio. Most recently, Todd has been concentrating on composing experimental electronic music. He has been teaching music lessons and summer camps to students of all ages and skill levels for the past several years with Hummingbird Music School. He also teaches music engineering and the recording arts. Yoonsun “Sunny” K. Piano, Group Piano Sunny is a classically trained pianist who started playing at the age of 5. She studied piano at the College of Music at Hanyang University in Seoul, South Korea, where she received a Bachelor of Music degree in Piano Performance. She has been teaching private lessons to children and adults for over 30 years, working as an accompanist throughout the Bay Area and singing and performing with several San Francisco choirs. Stella L. Piano, Group Piano, Mandarin Group Piano Having always been involved with music, Stella's passion quickly led her to musical education, giving her decades of experience teaching, singing, and performing in choirs. Her longest tenure is with the Crystal Children's Choir. She has conducted various levels, from Preparatory to Concert Choir (K-12). Stella has led numerous choirs and received prestigious music festival awards around the United States, and globally, she has had the opportunity to bring and conduct choirs to Canada, Taiwan, and Austria. Beyond these two decades of experience, Stella is part of FCSN and a music teacher at the Community School of Music and Art, holding a Music for Minors certificate. Joshua M. Flute, Clarinet, Saxophone, Piano, Ukulele Joshua is a multi-instrumentalist and composer/improviser. He graduated from Brown University, earning a B.A. in Music through their multimedia program, and holds an M.F.A. in Music Performance from Mills College. In addition to teaching privately, Joshua has served as a guest instructor at Mills College and has held various instrument and ensemble teaching positions at local music schools. He has performed and recorded with numerous local music groups, and his own music has been featured in festivals and conferences nationwide. Michelle C. Flute, Piano Recognized for her “big, lavish sound,” flutist Michelle (B.M., San Francisco Conservatory of Music) enjoys an active career as a soloist and orchestral musician. She has performed in various venues around the world, from the Bayeux Cathedral in France to Carnegie Hall in New York. A pedagogue of flute and piano, Michelle emphasizes the usage of music as a method of storytelling. Students learn the mechanics of the instrument and are given tools on how to practice, problem-solve, and ultimately teach themselves. From here, students develop a freedom of expression that manifests into a unique narrative told through the language of music. Ceci L. Violin, Viola Born and raised in Oakland, Ceci started playing the violin at age 10. As an active orchestral player, she regularly performs with the Stockton Symphony, California Symphony, & Marin Symphony. Ceci has performed and worked with leading musicians such as Michael Bublé, Sarah Brightman, Yo-Yo Ma, Emanuel Ax, and Riccardo Muti. Ceci also maintains a full studio teaching violin and is the violin teacher at Music for Minors. She received her B.M. and M.M. in Violin Performance from the Chicago College of Performing Arts. Garrett M. Drums, Percussion Holding a Doctorate of Musical Arts in Percussion Performance, Garrett is a solo and collaborative percussionist specializing in contemporary percussion performance and new music in a wide variety of settings. Though his focus has primarily been geared toward 20th- and 21st-century music, Garrett also has played in symphony orchestras, jazz bands, and other various musical ensembles worldwide. As an educator, Garrett has presented masterclasses and clinics at universities and conservatories around the world, and we are thrilled that he has joined the Hummingbird team. Teaching Mentorships As part of our commitment to supporting every step of the musical journey, Hummingbird Music School is proud to team with local high schools to offer exceptional students the opportunity to develop their teaching skills in real-world settings. Our 2024-2025 class of student teachers: Ethan B. (Group Piano) Laurelin S. (Grouop Piano, Piano) Caelyn C. (Piano) Join Our Team! Hummingbird Music School is hiring! Contact us to learn more. Apply Now Hummingbird Music School 2261 Market Street Suite 5984 San Francisco, CA 94114 Phone: 650-547-9954 Email Us Navigate Home About Us Awards Offerings Calendar Careers News Contact Us Follow Us Follow Follow Follow Franchise © 2024 Hummingbird Music School. Hummingbird Wine Bar brings new wine club, variety to Midtown News Sports Entertainment Opinion Email Us Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals MONEY Hummingbird Wine Bar brings new wine club, variety to Midtown TaMaryn Waters Tallahassee Democrat The opening for a new wine bar didn't go quite as planned, largely thanks to the pandemic of a century. However, even without a debut, wine at the Hummingbird Wine Bar is still flowing — just in its members' homes. The new Midtown attraction features a Wine Club where members sip selections that reach beyond readily available options in grocery stores, owner Greg Hajcak says. His vision is to create a cultural home for residents to appreciate and explore a range of wines. The Hummingbird will offer guided and blind tastings, among other things. Also, on the menu will be beer, cheese boards, salads and paninis. Hajcak says he'll work with guest chefs from local restaurants. Looking for a free mini puzzle? Play the USA TODAY Quick Cross now. It's located at 1216-4 N. Monroe St., in the same row of shops as Bruegger's Bagels. Hajcak says the grand opening date hasn’t been set. The tentative plan is to shoot for a gradual opening with members only and events, such as guided tastings, that can take place on the patio. That step could take place in late June or mid-July. Reduced seating inside could follow. However, the Wine Club, a member-based feature of the business, was part of the original plan and kicked off in May with about 55 members. This month, Hajcak says the Wine Club is projected to have about 80 members. “I think the reception has been super positive. We’ve had zero people drop out, which is amazing,” Hajcak said. “We’re pretty confident that people are excited about it and enjoying the wines that we are picking out for them.” He said the wine list is curated to be “exciting wines” some offerings on the wine rack could land in the “weird” category. Natural wines, for example, are growing in popularity in big cities and can be “a bit funkier than what people are used to,” Hajcak said. “Some of them can almost taste a little more like a sour beer,” he explained. “Another way that we mean that there is a lot of really amazing wine out there and different varietals than people are used to seeing in the grocery store that are fantastic.” Other offerings include a Pinot Grigio from Slovenia that fits the realm of orange wines, Hajcak said, adding orange wines are increasingly popular.  Another offering, a rose from Spain (100% Grenache), "will knock your socks off," he said. Hajcak continued his wine tour with a mention of a Picpoul De Pinet from France (the Picpoul grape is lesser-known, but a very old French varietal). He said it would appeal to those who like a "zippy fresh white wines with minerality, like an Albarino." "In addition, we're bringing our members some really unique reds," he added. "For instance, from Oregon, we're going to feature a 100% Gamay, and another that is 100% Graciano. "These are both more typically 'old world' grapes that feature in French and Spanish wines, respectively, but are doing really well in hands of some outstanding wine makers in the Pacific Northwest. We're also delivering some classics, including a Nebbiolo from Italy and a Shiraz from Australia." Contact TaMaryn Waters at tlwaters@tallahassee.com or follow @TaMarynWaters on Twitter. Hummingbird Wine Club | Join the Local Wine Community Home About Us Events By the Glass Market Wine Club Contact us ABOUT US About Us Market Wine Club By the Glass Events Contact us The Hummingbird Wine Club The Hummingbird offers an affordable, curated local wine club membership.  As a member of our wine club, you'll join a local community of wine lovers and will receive discounts and exclusive access to our tastings and special events. How It Works Curated Packs We curate a selection of 3-6 whites, reds, or mixed packs every month. Sign-Up Online Easily sign-up online for a 3-pack or 6-pack wine club option. Easy Pick-Up All wine clubs are ready for pick up 240 Glynn Street on the 3rd week of each month. HALF CLUB 3 bottles of wine (red, white, rosé & bubbly depending on month) hand-selected by our knowledgeable wine partners with tasting and pairing notes to accompany each selection. We also offer a red wine only 3-pack option and white (bubbly & rosé included) only 3-pack option. $50.00 / month + tax Click the button below to sign up! Half Club 3-Pack Red Wine 3-Pack White Wine 3-Pack Full Club 6 bottles of wine (2-3 red, 2 white, 1-2 rosé & bubbly depending on month) hand-selected by our knowledgeable wine partners with tasting and pairing notes to accompany each selection. $90.00 / month + tax Click the button below to sign up! Full Club 6-Pack Club Benefits All wine club members receive 10% off retail wine Discounts to Hummingbird and 240 events One free flight per month First access to ticketed events Common Questions See some common questions and answers below, or call us at 770-703-2320 . Is there a minimum month of commitment for a Hummingbird Wine Club membership? No, We want you to love it, if you don’t or if life changes, you can cancel at any time. The best way to cancel is to email or call us. We asked for a 48 notice prior to your billing date. When and where do I pick up my wines? All wine clubs are ready for pick up at the Hummingbird Wine Bar and Market, the third weke of each month. Our team will send you an email and reminder prior to pickup. Please bring your reusable bag each time. Do I automatically get charged every month (even if I don’t pick up)? Yes. Our system automatically charges every month on your renewal date. We may pause your subscription if your club is not picked up after 2 months and we cannot get in touch with you. Can I pause my subscription? Yes, you can pause each month. To reactivate simply email us. While your subscription is paused, you will not be eligible for wine club benefits such as discounts and exclusive events. What if I like a wine  in the club pack? Can I buy more of it? Well, some of our wine club wines are very limited so we may not have extra for sale, but if we do of course. Just ask. And remember as a wine club member you always receive 10% off on all wines. Is there a cutoff to purchase subscriptions for each month’s offerings? Yes, yes there is. Since we have to go and do the digging, the procuring, the packaging, and the rest of the humming birding, we need to have all subscription orders in prior to the 10th of each month. So, if you stumble across Hummingbird and order your subscription after the 10th of a particular month, you will be enrolled for the following month’s subscription box. Your initial payment will go towards the following month’s offerings and each subsequent charge will follow suit. What happens if I can’t pick up my wine? Members have 60 days from the start of pickups to get their wine. After 60 days they forfeit their ownership of the box. Members are not eligible for a refund on forfeited boxes. How do I cancel my membership? We’d be so sad to see you go, but if you must, memberships can be cancelled online or you can contact us at info@roundtowncollaborations or 770-703-2320.  Your membership must be cancelled 48 hours prior to the date of your recurring payment.
